item.title: judge orders quick trial in philadelphia church sex case
item.description: a judge on friday skipped a preliminary hearing and ordered an immediate trial for a catholic monsignor, two priests and others named in the sexual abuse scandal rocking the archdiocese of philadelphia.

item.title: riesch leapfrogs vonn and sets up a showdown
item.description: lindsey vonn, who entered friday's slalom with a 27-point edge, now trails maria riesch by 3 in the world cup women's overall standings heading into saturday's giant slalom.

item.title: garcia done in on back nine
item.description: since 2004 when he tied for fourth, sergio garcia has missed three cuts at the masters and not finished higher than a tie for 38th.

item.title: seabrook, hossa lead blackhawks past red wings
item.description: brent seabrook and marian hossa each had a goal and an assist to help the chicago blackhawks beat the detroit red wings 4-2 on friday night.

item.title: tsunami alters sushi markets
item.description: american sushi bars are turning to other sources for fish in response to the devastation of the seafood supply in northern japan.

item.title: danisco board backs raised $6.64 billion dupont bid
item.description: danish food ingredients firm danisco urged shareholders on monday to accept dupont's raised $6.64 billion bid, and fund managers welcomed the "decent offer" saying it was likely to succeed.

item.title: libyan forces chase rebels into tunisia
item.description: libyan troops chased rebel fighters across the border with tunisia, indiscriminately firing in the area before being captured by the tunisian military, witnesses said.

item.title: ravens owner: bears stain 'their great legacy' with botched trade fallout
item.description: the fallout from the botched trade between the baltimore ravens and chicago bears on thursday has reached the ownership level.

item.title: lou dobbs says tv is first love, not politics
item.description: lou dobbs, the pugnacious former cnn news anchor who flirted with the idea of running for u.s. president, is back where he wants to be, hosting a television show and free from his old network.

item.title: it's not listed. but it's definitely for sale.
item.description: 'pocket deals,' in which a seller informally engages a broker but doesn't sign a contract or list the property, are on the rise.

item.description: khloe kardashian and lamar odom tell ellen degeneres they both had second thoughts about doing a reality show.

item.title: s&p cuts ireland; fitch in downgrade threat
item.description: standard & poor's cut ireland's debt rating by just one notch and gave the thumbs-up to its bank bill on friday but rival fitch's warning of another downgrade and a big drop in growth expectations spelled trouble ahead.

item.title: the newest wiretaps in the galleon investigation
item.description: the recorded conversations between two former galleon group employees show that prosecutors have continued to use cooperating witnesses and wiretaps to investigate traders in raj rajaratnam's orbit.

item.title: drought expands dramatically in texas, losses mount
item.description: another dry week in the southern united states has driven the spread of a devastating drought further across texas and neighboring states, promising to add to economic losses that could top $3 billion.

item.title: poll: japanese wary on nuke crisis
item.description: poll finds more than three-quarters of japanese voters do not trust government information on the nuclear crisis.

item.title: tornadoes rake florida, overturn planes and vehicles
item.description: tornadoes and thunderstorms raked across central florida from west to east on thursday, flipping over some small planes and some vehicles, damaging homes and buildings and causing power outages, emergency service officials said.

item.title: enrique iglesias not touring with britney spears
item.description: oops! the promotional blitz for britney spears latest album got off to a rough start on tuesday when spanish heartthrob enrique iglesias denied that he would go on tour with the pop starlet.

item.title: ft won't give up subscriber relationship to apple
item.description: the financial times wants to keep selling subscriptions for its digital news directly to readers rather than surrender control of new customers who sign up via apple's ipad, the managing director of ft.com said.

item.description: pope benedict xvi will be in satellite contact with two italian astronauts aboard the international space station in what would be the first ...

item.title: greek town rises up against planned landfill
item.description: for three months, the residents of keratea have been in a violent standoff with the police over plans for a huge landfill.

item.title: bp shares hit by manslaughter report, downgrade
item.description: shares in oil major bp fell on tuesday on a report the company's managers could face manslaughter charges following the gulf of mexico oil spill, which could lead to much higher fines over the disaster.

item.title: ivorians flee after clashes, gbagbo camp defiant
item.description: dozens of people left a district of ivory coast's commercial capital on sunday after gun battles, and presidential claimant alassane ouattara made it back from an au summit, despite concerns about his security.

item.title: israel to build settler homes after palestinian attack
item.description: israel said on sunday it would build several hundred homes for settlers in the occupied west bank, a day after a palestinian attack killed an israeli couple and three of their children in a settlement.

item.description: kobe bryant had plenty to say about how he wants to help end homelessness in los angeles, but was silent about new lakers coach mike brown.

item.title: nigeria post-election violence killed 800: rights group
item.description: more than 800 people were killed and 65,000 displaced in three days of violence following a presidential election in april won by president goodluck jonathan, human rights watch said on monday.

item.description: about 40 percent of high school students have tried marijuana, although teenagers who take part in sports or other extracurricular activities are less likely to use the drug, a new study shows.

item.description: with only a few weeks left on her contract, "cbs evening news" anchor katie couric said on wednesday she has not made any decisions about her future.

item.description: the parents of a college student who killed himself after his sexual encounter was shown online do not hold his former roommate criminally responsible for the death but do want him prosecuted for invading their son's privacy, their attorney said on tuesday.
